contextId.information: Moses uses a question to rebuke Eleazar and Ithamar. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "You should have eaten ... before him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why have you not eaten ...  before him?

contextId.information: These sacrifices were to be eaten with joy and happiness. Aaron uses a question to emphasize that Yahweh would not be pleased for him to eat the sacrifices since he is sad because of his sons' deaths. This question may be translated as a statement. AT: "certainly, Yahweh would not have been pleased." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: would it have been pleasing in the sight of Yahweh?
